moves.1... e5 2. Nf3 d6: Philidor's  defense, I much prefer Nc6.
moves.3... c6 4. d4 Qe7: ? What's that for? To protect the pawn on e5? Why not Nd7?
moves.5. dxe5 dxe5 6. Be2: Wanting to castle early, but Bc4 is probably better.
moves.6... h6: ? A waste of a move, I wouldn't have wanted to play Bg5, so black was better off developing.
moves.7. O-O f5: That opens it up a bit.
moves.10... O-O-O 11. Bd3 Bxd3 12. Qxd3: Wanting to attack now, before black arranges his defense to suit his king.
moves.12... Ngf6: Black now has a decent position, except needs to develop his dark-squared bishop.
moves.13. Bf4 Qf7: My next move is my almost-fatal mistake.
moves.14. Nxe5: (?) I didn't see the threat of Rxd3 after Nxe5. So this almost lost me the game.
moves.14... Nxe5 15. Qf5+ Ned7: Now black has established a good position, and is up +2.
moves.23... Kd7: After Qxb7+, black must defend with Nc7 or Bc7.
moves.24. Nxd5: !! I have eliminated the piece that was needed to block the check of Qxb7+
moves.24... Qxd5: My plan all comes together, and with my next move, my opponent resigns.
moves.25. Qxb7+: At one point, around move 19, I was going to resign, I think that's why I did Qd2, because I felt like resigning, I was unconfident and didn't really care about my move, so never give up, always go till the end!! It's not over until it IS over.
